Judul: DOES MICROSTRUCTURE SENTIMENT SIGNIFICANTLY PREDICT STOCK RETURN?
Abstrak: By using IDX market data (both daily and transaction data) from 2003 to 2011, this research aims to examine how good microstructure sentiment proxies from previous literature (already tested in developed market) are in predicting returns and identifying how different stock characteristic (based on market capitalization) reacts towards each microstructure sentiment proxies in Indonesia. Moreover, this research aims to choose sentiment proxies that are eligible for building Ã‚Â„bottom up‟ sentiment index at Indonesia. Microstructure variables that are related with market efficiency according to Kim & Stoll (2014) are: information (PIN, BSI, and NIT), volatility (VOL and MOM), liquidity (LIQ and STO) and added with market behavior by author (DIS). The null hypothesis of this research, joint abnormal return ) and joint beta coefficient , for each sentiment proxies are statistically not significant against the alternative hypothesis that both variables must be significant. Using Fama-Macbeth 2-stages regression with Hansen-Hodrick and Newey-West correction, it was established that VOL5, VOL60, DIS5, DIS20, and LIQ statistically can reject the null hypothesis significantly. Moreover, this research has sucessfully identified how different stock characteristic (based on market capitalization) reacts towards each microstructure sentiment proxies.
